Have high expertise in writing web aplications for highloads so as writing fast MySQL queries. Participated in several IT conferences and festivals as a speaker.

anatoliy_fedorenko.title: Back-End Web Developer
anatoliy_fedorenko.bio: Write code for more than 2 years. Work on various projects that require backend solutions using Go programming language. Participated in several IT conferences and festivals as a speaker. Enjoy sharing knowledge and networking.

artur_norov.name: Artur Norov
artur_norov.title: Senior Software Developer
artur_norov.bio: He has a passion in programming since high school. Participant in a local competitions. Later he continued to study programming at the university. During the training, he managed to work in various IT specialties, which gave a comprehensive vision of the developed product before and after its release in production and interaction with users. At the moment, the last 4 years, most of the time is engaged in android development. Sees the exclusivity of mobile applications specifically for the needs of the financial sector

emad_ehsan.title: Web Technologies
emad_ehsan.bio: I am Co Founder and CTO of Traverous. I am an active Open Source contributor and a Top Trending GitHub Developer. I work on everything that fascinates me. I have helped more than 200k developers through my OSS contributions and writings and served more than 3k users directly through my venture. I am from a small village of Bhakkar, a distant a backward district of Punjab, Pakistan. I am a fast learner and a passionate traveler. Though so far only in Pakistan :)

ihor_dvoretskyi.title: Developer Advocate
ihor_dvoretskyi.bio: Ihor Dvoretskyi is a Developer Advocate at Cloud Native Computing Foundation (CNCF), closely working with the open source communities within the Cloud Native ecosystem (including Kubernetes, Helm, and others).  At CNCF, Ihor acts as an advocate for the technology projects from the Cloud Native ecosystem. Besides that, he helps driving multiple developer relations programs, including the CNCF Meetup and Ambassadors programs, mentorship programs, and many others.  Ihor is a co-founder and an emeritus co-chair of the Kubernetes Product Management Special Interest Group (SIG-PM); also he was actively involved in the release process holding a role of the Features Lead during the multiple Kubernetes release cycles.  With an engineering (DevOps) and PM background, Ihor has been responsible for the projects tightly bound to the cloud computing space, containerized workloads and Linux systems.
ihor_dvoretskyi.shortBio: Ihor Dvoretskyi is a Developer Advocate at Cloud Native Computing Foundation (CNCF), closely working with the open source communities within the Cloud Native ecosystem (including Kubernetes, Helm, and others).
ihor_dvoretskyi.name: Ihor Dvoretskyi

siddarth_ajmera.shortBio: Siddharth is a full stack JavaScript Developer, currently focused on developing applications on Angular and Firebase in its various flavors.
siddarth_ajmera.name: Siddharth Ajmera
siddarth_ajmera.title: Angular, Web Technologies
siddarth_ajmera.bio: Siddharth is a full stack JavaScript Developer, currently focused on developing applications on Angular and Firebase in its various flavors. He works for TATA Consultancy Services as an I.T. Analyst and is responsible for bootstrapping digital transformation engagements, enforcing Angular style guides and reviewing Angular code. He is very active in the Angular Community on channels like StackOverflow, Medium and YouTube. He is also a published author on Udemy and BPBOnline (TypeScript, Angular, Firebase & Angular Material Masterclass; Firebase Authentication masterclass with Angular). Siddharth loves to share his knowledge of Angular development with others via StackOverflow Answers, YouTube Videos, and Medium Articles, full of tips about producing quality software. Siddharth also loves to travel and is a hobbyist photographer. He goes by the name of "SiddAjmera" and can be reached out to, on social channels with the same.

tanya_butenko.name: Tanya Butenko
tanya_butenko.title: Software engineer / Founder, CEO
tanya_butenko.bio: Tanya Butenko is passionate about free education and diversity and doing all she can to support and promote women in IT. Teacher, translator, manager previously, nowadays software engineer and IT community activist.  After 3-month IT course in 2014 Tanya stepped into IT world and started her journey as a web developer. Today she is working at Hireup as a software engineer, co-organizer of Women Who Code Sydney chapter, Muses Code JS (previously known as NodeGirls) Founder, CEO. Also Google Developer Expert in Web Technologies and international speaker.
tanya_butenko.shortBio: Tanya Butenko is passionate about free education and diversity and doing all she can to support and promote women in IT.

zuhurshoh_rahmatullaev.title: Co-founder
zuhurshoh_rahmatullaev.bio: An entrepreneur in fin-tech. Zuhurshoh co-founded Alif Capital, a fin-tech organization in Tajikistan. He is  currently working on a project in Tashkent, Uzbekistan.

heather_downing.shortBio: Heather is a passionate coder and developer advocate for Okta, the OAuth and Identity Management solution. She has experience working with Fortune 500 companies building enterprise-level voice, mobile and C#/.Net applications. She focuses on external thought leadership, encouraging fellow programmers to present on topics outside of the office and in the community. She is an international technical speaker and co-host of the YouTube channel The Hello World Show -- a weekly video series that interviews software masters and teaches the audience something valuable in less than 10 minutes.
heather_downing.name: Heather Downing
heather_downing.title: Senior Developer Advocate
heather_downing.bio: “Curious Through and Through” Heather is a passionate coder and entrepreneur. She has experience working with Fortune 500 companies building enterprise-level voice, mobile and C#/.Net applications. She focuses on external thought leadership, encouraging fellow programmers to present on topics outside of the office and in the community. She is an international technical speaker and co-host of the YouTube channel The Hello World Show -- a weekly video series that interviews software masters and teaches the audience something valuable in less than 10 minutes. ​Heather encourages those with nontraditional backgrounds to enter the world of software development, as she changed careers at 27 and does not have a degree - yet has built a reputation as an early adapter of new tech. She is an advocate of women in tech, and part of Kansas City Women in Technology. When not coding, Heather spends her time as a competitive equestrian and learning the art of mounted archery.
